definition:
A *permutation group* on a set $A$ is a subgroup of the symmetric group
$S_A$.

fact: conjugating stabilizer of an element by permutation produces stabilizer of permuted element {#fact-conjugating-stabilizer-of-an-element-by-permutation-produces-stabilizer-of-permuted-element .unnumbered}
=================================================================================================

$A$ set

$a\in A$

$X$ permutation group on $A$

$\sigma\in X$

$\sigma \mathrm{Stab}_X(a) \sigma^{-1}=  \mathrm{Stab}_X(\sigma(a))$

fact: if a permutation group acts transitively, then the intersection of conjugated stabilizers is the identity {#fact-if-a-permutation-group-acts-transitively-then-the-intersection-of-conjugated-stabilizers-is-the-identity .unnumbered}
===============================================================================================================

$A$ set

$a\in A$

$X$ permutation group on $A$

$\cap_{\sigma\in X} \sigma \mathrm{Stab}_X(a)=1$

[*Note: This is a “seed” entry written using a short-hand format
described in .*]{}
